intro: Bartsia inaequalis subsp. duripilis, commonly known as the rough bartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and North Africa. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest edges. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with two lips and a distinctive spurred structure. The subspecies is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
